Reviews.Content: Young Couple, loved it!       Inside the Hall
Reviews.Author: R0yK

Reviews.Content: Pretty much agree with the last review Not a bad hotel-- its location is a little unusual- down a dirt road that's a little hard to access if you're driving and coming from the wrong direction across the intersection.A little quirky, it is reminisicent of a big old mansion that was converted to a hotel.The staff we interacted with weren't rude, but they weren't overly friendly either. We just came and went and it seemed they hardly noticed. But the room was comfortable enough and it was quiet. No complaints, just nothing that was memorable. If the price is in your budget and the location is about where you want to be, you could do a lot worse.
Reviews.Author: MaxOregon

Reviews.Content: Bellisima Villa Betania       Terrace - great for breakfast
Reviews.Author: Wandering_Scientist

Reviews.Content: Good service, large rooms with great breakfast included We were pleased with this quiet location outside of Florence. It is a long walk so we preferred to take the public bus that runs in front of the hotel and goes directly into the city. We also took a cab home one night from the city. We had a rental car which we kept parked in the hotel driveway. The rooms were very spacious and clean. The bathrooms were also large. The breakfast was sufficient and lovely on the outside patio. The staff was very attentive and helpful. Do not stay here if you like to stay at big hotel chains. We enjoyed our stay here and would go back again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Fawlty Towers Very scruffy hotel, in need of desperate renovation before the building falls down. The floor in our room shook when you walked on it. The bed was so uncomfortably we had to put the mattress on the floor to get any sleep, and the mirror in the bathroom doubled as a window!! The remaining furniture in the room looked like it had been rescued from a skip. All in all a complete rip off. I have never before paid so much money for such a bad room. The cost should be at least half what it is before anyone considers going there.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: a lifetime of memories A PERFECT place to stay, Villa Betania had all the ammenities of a hotel without the feeling of anonymity. What I am trying to say is that as soon as we pulled up the crunchy gravel drive, parked the car and walked up the herb lined front walkway, I felt like I was at home or at least an heiress to a wonderful estate. We were greeted by handsome dogs and the friendliest, most welcoming man you could imagine. The place was warmly decorated for the holidays and the more permanent artwork, furniture and fixtures further instilled in us the feeling of Italian supremecy in the field of interior design! The foyer was home-y and beautiful at the same time. (by no means stuffy or impersonal) Our room was spacious (and we slept three to a room!) as was the bathroom which we have found to be quite unusual in our travels around Italy. Every morning we rose, got dressed for the day, and went (dare I say sashayed) downstairs to the sunny kitchen to enjoy yummy treats from a beautifully laid buffet. We sat at small round cafe tables and enjoyed the garden view out a set of tall French doors. Every night, we would drag our bodies home from a full day of sightseeing,shopping and eating the most amazing meals. We were always welcomed at the door. Then we climbed the stairs and opened our door to see perfectly made beds and lots of fluffy white towels...I will ALWAYS recommend this wonderful place to stay for absolutely anyone who wants to enjoy an Italian dream
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Never will forget the rooster! The warmth and hospitality of the Betania staff will not be forgotten. The pleasures of the garden and the scent of jasmine are permanent memories. What a lovely place to sit and chat! I still want to grab that rooster and turn him into coq au vin, though.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Excellent Price/Performance Hotel Hotel Villa Betania is not as glamorous as the five star hotel but its friendly atmosphere makes the trip more pleasant. The hotel owner gave good recommendations on the restaurants (reasonable price). However, some local restaurants DO NOT accept credit cards.This hotel has its own reservation website, www.villabetania.it.The advantages for staying at this hotel:--good location quiet and relaxing surroundings 5 minutes walk to the taxi stand taxi cost range 5 to 10 euro to the city center 25 to 30 minutes walk to Ufizi Museum bus stop across the street from the hotel--museum reservations the hotel will purchase the museum tickets upon request and you don't need to wait in line--free breakfast breakfast is included in the room charge--free parking--internet access with a minimal chargeThe only disadvantage for staying here is that there is no elevator.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: a quite respite The hotel was not in top repair and the walk to the city center may be a bit much for some people. But we enjoyed the quiet neighbor, a strong contrast from the congested city. Parking was easy and off the street. The host was great. It was worth the price. We would go there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Charming small hotel in Florence Villa Betania is a small, charming hotel immediately outside of the historical walls in Florence, in the Porta Romana neighborood. I find it of excellent quality and of very reasonable prices for the area. I stayed there several times, I routinely send there friends and colleagues, and all have been favorably impressed. The young owners are nice and do their best to help you with whatever need. The Villa itself is an old Tuscan residence, and it is very pleasant to sit in the garden for a coffee or an aperitif. City centre is well within walking distance. For coming back at night (uphill...) city buses go right by.Gianna CauzziFirenze
